summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel and a contractor regarding the review and production of discovery materials, specifically email files. The discussion focuses on redactions, cover letters for recipients named Noel and Thomas, and the handling of documents related to Tartaglione and Epstein.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: Mentioned as a recipient for a cover letter accompanying the discovery production. Likely an attorney or legal representative involved in the case.

persons.name: Thomas
persons.context: Mentioned as a recipient for a cover letter accompanying the discovery production. Likely an attorney or legal representative involved in the case.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: A subject of the email review; documents concern his conditions of confinement and an incident related to Jeffrey Epstein. His counsel is mentioned regarding a leak/retaliation issue.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced in relation to an incident where Tartaglione discussed potentially injuring him, and in email chains that are flagged for potential withholding.

connections.description: Tartaglione was questioned about an attack on Epstein and discussed potentially injuring him, as noted in email chains under review.

events.title: Discovery Production Finalization
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office personnel finalize the production of discovery materials, including applying redactions, stamping documents, and drafting cover letters for recipients Noel and Thomas.

events.title: Review of Email Files
events.description: A reviewer flags email chains related to Tartaglione's counsel discussing a leak/retaliation story about Tartaglione being questioned about an attack on Epstein, and where Epstein informs a psychologist about Tartaglione's discussion.

events.title: Discovery Review Project Initiation
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney assigns a contractor to review email files to identify pages related solely to Tartaglione's conditions of confinement or emails regarding Touhy, for redaction purposes.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was preparing a discovery production in October 2020, involving redactions and cover letters for recipients named Noel and Thomas.
Email files under review contained references to an incident where inmate Tartaglione discussed potentially injuring Jeffrey Epstein, and a related leak/retaliation story.
The review specifically aimed to identify documents related to Tartaglione's conditions of confinement and emails regarding 'Touhy' for redaction.
The document indicates ongoing legal and investigative activity related to Epstein and associated individuals well after Epstein's death.
